Worked with team to resolve issues and moved over a weekend.  Started training and project on Azure and AWS project to move production servers and services to cloud services. Worked on cost analysis to procure a complete change over from physical to cloud environment.  Moved complete office infrastructure to new office. Designed network infrastructure. Worked with major ISPs (ATT/TWC) to provide internet and managed services. Setup wireless infrastructure. Put in PBX Grandstream system and worked with providers to move from Analog to Fiber with DID's for PBX installation.  Restructured backup process to include Dell Appassure - configured to backup 22 VM Windows server, including 2 SQL and 2 Microsoft Exchange Servers  Completed P2V project using ESXi 5.5 with Essentials licensing. Converted 22 servers  Configured Orion Solar Winds to monitor and report on all network devices utilizing several monitoring processes.  Worked with vendor to cut over all remote locations from ATT/Sprint ISP Management to the vendor. This took the work load off of IT and allowed an outsourced company to monitor and manage 21 remote offices. Analyzes information to determine, recommend, and plan layout for type of computers and peripheral equipment modifications to existing systems. story:
Let me weave this professional journey into a story.

After earning his BS in Business Management from Ottawa University, our protagonist embarked on an impressive technology career spanning over two decades. His story begins in 2001 when he joined the Kansas State Government as a contractor, cutting his teeth on fundamental IT systems.

The plot thickens in 2007 when he stepped into the role of IT Director, where he orchestrated a remarkable transformation. He took a modest 4-server operation and expanded it into a robust infrastructure of 32 servers, masterfully virtualizing all but three. For six years, he was the guardian of this digital realm, supporting 90 end-users while maintaining the delicate balance of system security and efficiency.

In 2013, our tech veteran evolved into a Systems Engineer, facing perhaps his most ambitious challenge yet: relocating an entire production network from MainMark DataCenter to Layered Tech ATC. Picture him orchestrating this digital migration, wielding cutting-edge tools like Cisco UCS blade servers and EMC VNX 5300 SAN technology. He was like a conductor, harmonizing various technologies into a seamless performance.

The latest chapter of his story, beginning in 2014, finds him in Sprint ISP Management. Here, he's become something of a digital architect, designing network infrastructures and leading critical server migrations to data centers without missing a beat. He's orchestrated complete office relocations, modernized communication systems from analog to fiber, and is currently pioneering the organization's journey into cloud computing with Azure and AWS.

Throughout his journey, he's accumulated an impressive arsenal of certifications and skills, from CCNA to MSCE, mastering everything from traditional networking to cutting-edge cloud technologies. He's like a technological polyglot, fluent in the languages of Windows, Linux, virtualization, and network security.

What makes his story particularly compelling is how he's consistently stayed ahead of the technology curve, adapting from Windows 95 all the way to Windows 10, from physical servers to cloud infrastructure, always embracing the next big technological leap while maintaining rock-solid system reliability.

Today, he stands as a seasoned IT professional who can not only handle the complex technical challenges of modern enterprise IT but also translate these solutions into tangible business value. His story is one of continuous evolution, adaptability, and technical excellence in an ever-changing digital landscape.
